text.section:
Any bank may, as provided in this subtitle:
Consolidate with one or more other banks to form a new consolidated bank;
Merge into another bank or have one or more other banks merged into it; or
Transfer its assets to another bank.

If the successor will be a commercial bank:
The consolidation, merger, or transfer of assets shall be made in accordance with the provisions of this subtitle; and
If one of the constituent banks is a national banking association or a federally chartered savings bank or savings and loan association, federal law governs its actions and the rights of its stockholders.

If the successor will be a national banking association or a federally chartered savings bank or savings and loan association:
Federal law governs:
The actions of a constituent bank;
The rights of its stockholders; and
The effect of the consolidation, merger, or transfer of assets on its rights, franchises, interests, and fiduciary duties; and
Except for this section and § 3-710 of this subtitle, the other provisions of this subtitle do not apply to the consolidation, merger, or transfer of assets.

If one of the constituent banks is an other-state bank:
Maryland law governs:
The actions of the banking institution;
The rights of its stockholders; and
The effect of the consolidation, merger, or transfer of assets on its rights, franchises, interests, and fiduciary duties; and
The law of the other state governs:
The actions of the other-state bank;
The rights of its stockholders; and
The effect of the consolidation, merger, or transfer of assets on its rights, franchises, interests, and fiduciary duties.
